oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jim Carr Tub Mill
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mills; Grains; Flour & meal industry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A water-powered tub mill (a type of grist mill) is pictured, along with a man watching it operate. The mill is constructed of wood and is located next to a creek.

A grist mill is a place where grains are ground into flour. This grist mill was used by Tennessee pioneers and was located in Sugarlands above the headquarters of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park until destroyed by a flood in 1951.

Tennessee State Capitol was erected between 1845 and 1853. The architect, William Strickland, died before the completion and is buried in the North Wall. President and Mrs. James K. Polk are buried on the grounds.

A full-scale replica of the Parthenon in Athens was built in 1897, as part of the Tennessee Centennial Exposition. In the 1920s, it was rebuilt on the same foundations but in concrete.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cornfield
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Corn; Plants
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: View of a unidentified crop of corn. On back is the quote: "Heap high the farmer's wintry hoard! Heap high the gold corn! No richer gift has Autumn poured From out her lavish horn! -Whittier".

Corn was the chief agricultural product almost from the beginning of human settlement in Tennessee. By 1840, Tennessee was the leading corn-producing state in the Union, with 12 percent of the nation's total. The value and amount of corn harvested peaked; in 1920.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Norris Dam, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dams; Rivers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: View of Norris Dam.

Norris Dam is a project of the Tennessee Valley Authority. Located on the Clinch River near Coal Creek, Tennessee and LaFollette, Tennessee. Norris Dam forms Norris Lake. The dam is designed to regulate the flow of water into the Tennessee River Navigation System.

Founded in 1920 as the Tennessee Eastman Corporation, the Tennessee Eastman Company (1951) was a division of the Eastman Kodak Company. The plant produced Eastman acetate yarn and stable fiber, Tenite, industrial chemicals and dyestuffs.
